item.title: Ys X: Proud Nordics coming west in early 2026 for Switch 2, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch 2

The definitive edition of Ys X: Nordics.

NIS America will release Ys X: Proud Nordics for Switch 2 and PC via Steam in early 2026 in the west, the publisher announced.

Ys X: Proud Nordics first launched for Switch 2 on July 31 in Japan. An Asian release followed on both Switch 2 and PC via Steam today.

Here is an overview of the game, via NIS America:

As the definitive edition of this critically acclaimed entry in the Ys series, Ys X: Proud Nordics offers all of the fast-paced combat and enthralling narrative of the original release, with new mechanics, a high-difficulty dungeon, and a brand-new storyline seamlessly integrated throughout the game.

After a tense encounter at sea, the young red-haired adventurer Adol and the proud Norman Karja find themselves bound together by shackles of Mana, and by the looming threat of an undying horde known as the Griegr, who seek to pillage the vibrant Obelia Gulf. Aboard their ship, the Sandras, Adol and Karja gather a trusty crew of friends and allies as they go head-to-head with the Griegr in one unforgettable journey!

item.title: 3D pixel art co-op adventure game Wildekin announced for Xbox Series, Xbox One, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

From Chucklefish and Cute Newt.

Publisher Chucklefish and developer Cute Newt have announced Wildekin, a 3D pixel art adventure game where up to four friends can build, explore, and survive together. It will launch for Xbox Series, Xbox One, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store in 2026. It will also be available via Game Pass.

Here is an overview of the game, via Chucklefish:

About

Wildekin is a 3D pixel-art adventure where up to four friends can build, explore, survive and thrive—or at least try to before some creature tries to turn you into a light snack!

Key Features

  • Explore Together – Up to four players can team up online to fight monsters, rescue lost Wildekin, and survive in the perilous Wilderness
  • Build Your Town – Construct stores and homes, assign jobs, craft gear, and decorate your weird little corner of the world
  • Live the Good Life – Celebrate seasonal festivals, take part in contests, fulfill requests, and befriend Wildekin each with oddly specific personalities and quirks

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Sony Interactive Entertainment sells stake in EVO to NODWIN Gaming
item.content:encoded:
PlayStation manufacturer to transition to global sponsor of the tournament.

Sony Interactive Entertainment has sold its stake in Evolution Championship Series to NODWIN Gaming, a company backed by the PlayStation manufacturer’s parent company Sony Group Corporation, the organization announced.

Sony Interactive Entertainment will become a new global sponsor of Evolution Championship Series through 2028, and “continue its commitment to the fighting game community through the PlayStation Tournaments platform and key products currently in development that appeal to fighting game players,” the organization said.

“When [Sony Interactive Entertainment] acquired EVO alongside RTS in 2021, our goal was to help the EVO community grow and spotlight the skills and passion of fighting game fans on a global stage,” said Sony Interactive Entertainment senior vice president and head of global partner development and relations Phil Rosenberg in a press release. “As [Sony Interactive Entertainment] transitions to become an EVO sponsor, the momentum for EVO has never been stronger, following a successful Las Vegas event and upcoming expansion to new regions. We look forward to supporting the continued growth of EVO globally.”

New co-owner NODWIN Gaming co-founder and managing direct Akshat Rathee added, “EVO was built by a team whose authenticity and passion for the fighting game community are unmatched. We will continue [Sony Interactive Entertainment]’s great work and honor the legacy of everyone who has made it what it is today, while opening the door for a new generation to experience the spirit of EVO.”

Qiddiya, which became a global partner of the tournament in 2024, also announced that it is investing in EVO co-owner and operator RTS, and will extend its global partnership with EVO through 2027.

“Teaming up with Qiddiya strengthens the future of RTS and what we’re building with EVO, an event that lives up to its name by driving real transformation in the fighting game community through new opportunities, deeper connections, and meaningful growth,” said RTS CEO Stuart Saw.

item.title: Satisfactory coming to PS5, Xbox Series on November 4
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for PC.

Coffee Stain Publishing and developer Coffee Stain Studios will release first-person open-world factory building game Satisfactory for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series on November 4, the companies announced.

Satisfactory first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Humble Store on June 8, 2020, followed by a full release on September 10, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

Satisfactory is a first-person open-world factory building game with a dash of exploration and combat. Play alone or with friends, explore an alien planet, create multi-story factories, and enter conveyor belt heaven!

Construct

Conquer nature by building massive factories across the land. Expand wherever and however you want. The planet is filled with valuable natural resources just waiting to be utilized. As an employee of FICSIT it’s your duty to make sure they come to good use.

Automate

Construct your factories with gracious perfection or build intricate webs of conveyor belts to supply all your needs. Automate trucks and trains to reach your faraway outposts and be sure to handle liquids properly by transporting them in pipes. It’s all about minimizing manual labour!

Explore and Exploit

Venture on expeditions to search for new materials and be sure to put everything to good use. Nature is yours to harvest! You have vehicles, jetpacks, jump pads and more at your disposal to make the exploration easier. Equip the proper safety gear as well, just in case you run into the local wildlife.

Key Features

  • Open World – Explore the huge (30km2) alien planet that is Massage-2(AB)b with its unique fauna and creatures.
  • Cooperative Play – Build a factory yourself or share the joy with your friends. Up to you!
  • Factory Building – Experience building a huge factory from a first-person perspective. Automate and optimize it to perfection for your personal satisfaction.
  • Customization – Customize your factory to your own liking. Build at high altitudes or over wide plains, there is almost no limits in the making of your tailor-made factory.
  • Vehicles – Travel the world with class. Use jump pads, factory carts, jetpacks, hypertubes, trucks or trains. The choice is yours!

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth trilogy for PS4 delayed to October 28 in the west
item.content:encoded:
• PS4

No longer due out on September 30.

Idea Factory International has delayed the PlayStation 4 versions of Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth1 +, Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth2: Sisters Generation, and Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth3: V Generation from their previously planned September 30 release date to October 28 in North America and Europe. Each game will be available both physically and digitally.

“Due to a manufacturing setback, it became unlikely that the games would launch on [September 30],” Idea Factory International said. “To ensure timely delivery, the Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth series will now launch on October 28.”

Pre-orders for the standard editions of each game will open via Idea Factory International Online Store on August 22 at 10:00 a.m. PT / 1:00 p.m. ET. A bundle including a 10 percent discount on all three games and a free Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth Collection slipcase will also be available.

Read more about each game here.

item.title: Mistfall Hunter third beta test for PC set for September
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Stand against the new Mist Lord.

Bellring Games will host the third beta test for third-person action player-versus-player-versus-environment extraction RPG Mistfall Hunter for PC via Steam in September, the developer announced. Registration is now available via the game’s Steam page.

The third beta test will introduce the following new features:

  • The Camp – A New Hub for Preparation, Lore, and Connection: The Camp is now the first place Gyldhunters see when they enter the world. This explorable hub area blends quiet moments of preparation with new layers of storytelling. Here, you’ll meet Dew, the mysterious goddess who guides your journey, and interact with new NPCs that offer quests, gear upgrades, auctions, and essential services. Invite friends, form parties, and strategize before calling upon Soekja to summon the boat that will carry you into the Gyldenmist.
  • New Class Path, Blasphemer Seers – The once-divine Seers now splinter. While some remain faithful, others walk a new path. Blasphemer Seers reject the Goddess of Light and channel their suffering into brutal close-quarters combat. Wielding maces infused with elemental devastation, they unleash a Special State that fuels explosive burst damage and savage flanking strikes. It’s a violent rebuke of divinity—and a deadly asset in the right hands.
  • New Boss: General Harald – Prepare for an unforgettable boss encounter—General Harald, former hero of Brandrgarde. Once a revered commander, his soul was lost in a desperate experiment to stop the Gyldenmist. Now, twisted by madness and power, Harald guards the ruins as a relentless executioner. Only the most fearless Gyldhunters will survive him—and claim the treasures he protects.
  • Playable Female Characters and Customization Debut – The female versions of all five core classes—Sorcerer, Black Arrow, Shadowstrix, Mercenary, and Seer—are now fully playable. Alongside this long-awaited feature, Beta 3 introduces the first wave of character customization, giving players more freedom to define their identity in the Age of Corrosion.

Mistfall Hunter is due out for Xbox Series and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store in 2025.
